title: Wrong architecture objects mixed in self-built compiler
body:
When using a self-built compiler on an Apple Silicon host to build a `x86_64-unknown-none` static library, `mach-o-arm64` objects get mixed into the output. This happens since https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/103732.

# Problem setup

```toml
# config.toml
# using stage1, built with `./x.py build`
changelog-seen = 2

[llvm]
targets = "AArch64;X86"

[build]
target = [
    "aarch64-apple-darwin",
    "x86_64-unknown-none",
]

[rust]
llvm-tools = true
lld = true
```

```
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
```

```rust
// foo.rs
#![no_std]

#[panic_handler]
fn panic(_: &core::panic::PanicInfo) -> ! {
    loop {}
}
```

```
$ rustc --crate-type staticlib --target x86_64-unknown-none foo.rs
$ objdump --archive-headers libfoo.a
```

# Results

1. 33b530e04099465a8029ef581202d52f4075558e
    * [33b530e.log](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/10116319/33b530e.log)
    * does not contain any `mach-o-arm64` files
2. 5984b1d86f0e7221c83c0d63b8d63fc0de9c5760 (the next commit)
    * [5984b1d.log](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/10116320/5984b1d.log)
    * contains `absvdi2.o: file format mach-o-arm64` and more
3. `nightly-2022-11-01` (the next nightly)
    * [nightly-2022-11-01.log](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/10116427/nightly-2022-11-01.log)
    * does not contain any `mach-o-arm64` files

CC: @stlankes
